newsitem.title: USA: Kodak moves advertising to Ogilvy & Mather.
newsitem.headline: Kodak moves advertising to Ogilvy & Mather.

text.p: Eastman Kodak Co said Monday it is assigning all advertising for its consumer imaging business to Ogilvy & Mather Worldwide, as of July 1, dropping its long-time ad agency J. Walter Thompson.

Ogilvy, now will handle advertising for Kodak film and traditional cameras, which was previously handled by J. Walter Thompson, Kodak said. A Kodak spokesman confirmed the company dropped Thompson for all its consumer advertising.
Both agencies are subsidiaries of WPP Group Plc.

"This switch in advertising assignments for Kodak consumer products reflects our need for a new creative focus and direction, said Carl Gustin, Kodak's chief marketing officer, in a statement. "Further, this move is aimed at improving Kodak's strategic focus and our ability to manage the brand on a worldwide basis,"

Ogilvy already handled Advantix Advanced Photo System products, one-time-use cameras, and corporate brand advertising, Kodak added. Ogilvy Atlanta, will continue to handle Kodak Digital & Applied Imaging business, the company said.

A Kodak spokesman said the company does not comment on its advertising budget or billings. He cited the need for a "new creative approach" to advertising for the shift in agencies and said Kodak had been pleased with Olgilvy's performance for the accounts it has handled since last year.
Ogilvy was not immediately available for comment.
